direction.raw_text: They say he's half brain-dead from all the steroids he's using. Max rolls over, trying to get back to sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a brutal motherfucker, man.  He loves what he does for a living. INT.  WELLES' MOTEL ROOM -- DAY Welles enters, carries an OVERNIGHT PACKAGE and his LOCK BOX.  At the desk, he tears open the package, opens the MANILA ENVELOPE inside; finds FIFTY THOUSAND DOLLARS in thousand dollar bills, wrapped in plastic and masking tape. Welles takes the lock box to the bed and works the combination, opens it.  He takes out the holster, stands looking down at the gun.  He puts the holster on. EXT.  1204 WAREHOUSE -- DAY Welles' Ford waits with turn signal on.  A car pulls out of a parking space.  Welles takes the space. INT.  WELLES' CAR -- DAY Max is in the passenger seat.  Welles looks to 1204.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't need to be here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of Junior P.I. would I be if I didn't go with you? INT.  1204 WAREHOUSE, SECOND FLOOR -- DAY Welles and Max get off the elevator, moving down the grey hall, to the black doors.  Welles pushes the INTERCOM BUTTON.  After a moment, the INTERCOM CRACKLES...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is it? Welles waits, presses the button again. INT.  DINO VELVET STUDIO -- DAY The doors BUZZ and Welles and Max warily enter this large, dark, converted warehouse.  Square pillars shoot from floor to ceiling.  Shafts of light cut down from high windows. A large THUG in a pinstripe suit crosses from a far DESK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in the wrong place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're looking for Mr. Velvet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not here. Welles looks around, at piles of PROPS; a huge faux-stone ANGEL and GARGOYLES, elaborate CANDELABRAS, a huge BIRDCAGE, massive WOODEN CROSS, NAZI FLAGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you tell him we're here to give him a large sum of money.  If he's not interested, we'll go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should leave now, before I have to remove you. Welles just stands looking at the thug.  A VOICE is HEARD...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show them in, Milo. Welles and Max look up.  There are SPEAKERS mounted high up on the pillars, and SURVEILLANCE CAMERAS looking down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard the boss, Milo. The disgruntled thug starts back across the studio towards a distant DOOR.  Welles and Max follow... They notice an elaborate set built in one corner, a TORTURE CHAMBER, complete with RACK and IRON MAIDEN. INT.  DINO VELVET'S OFFICE -- DAY Thug opens the door and lets Welles and Max in. The office is huge, windowless walls covered in thousands of PICTURES from every conceivable source, torn and cut, pinned up to form an indecipherable collage.  A tall LADDER leans against one wall, near three TELEVISIONS. DINO VELVET rises behind his desk, a small, bird-like man, wearing a black suit and bad hairpiece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in.  Make yourself comfortable. Welles shakes Dino's hand.  Max looks up at the walls. IMAGES; porn pictures, news photos, world leaders, autopsy photos, armies and insects, the naked and the dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an honor to meet you.  Thank you for seeing us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I do for you today? Welles sits.  Shelves behind Dino's desk are piled high with VIDEO CASSETTES, old MOVIE CAMERAS, big REELS of 16mm FILM. VIDEOS and MAGAZINES are stacked everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to commission a work.  I'm a great admirer of yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flattering.  And, who's your colorful little chum?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fellow investor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the only one still shooting film and transferring it to video. Nobody appreciates that kind of integrity anymore... the grain, the gritty look you get.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm glad you appreciate it. (to Welles) What would you say is your favorite piece? Welles considers.  Max glances over, looks back to the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know if I had to pick, it'd be "Choke," or "Devil."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Devil" frightened me as much as it excited me, but I'd be hard pressed to choose a favorite. Dino grins, showing yellowed teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said something about money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  What we're looking for is rather specific. Welles takes out an ENVELOPE, puts it on the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's five thousand dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five thousand now, five thousand on delivery. Two women, one white and one black, as long as they have large breasts. Hard bondage, or course.  Other than that, trusting your artistic interpretation, I have only two stipulations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to watch you work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll consider it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the other performer... it has to be that monster you use... the man in the mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's not him, there's no deal. Dino drums his painted fingernails on his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He might be interested... but it would mean another five thousand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well, I'll have to put my thinking-cap on about all this. You'll leave the money as a deposit? (off Welles' nod) Very good. Dino stands, picks up a still CAMERA off his desk and comes to look at Welles, studying him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a beautiful face... the way the light hits it.  I'd like to take your picture.  You don't mind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd rather you didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the problem? WELLES I'm camera shy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You trust me to keep your money, but not to take your picture?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those are two different kinds of trust. (stands) Thank you for your time.  I hope we can do business. Welles leaves.  Max goes with him.  Dino watches them leave. EXT.  MANHATTAN STREET -- NIGHT HORNS BLARE.  TWO CARS have collided head-on.  A large CROWD gathers.  One windshield's shattered, blood spattered.  The driver is slumped over the wheel, gushing blood. On a nearby street corner, Welles in on a PAY PHONE. HEAVY METAL can be HEARD filtered through the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, what do you say? INT.  DINO VELVET'S OFFICE -- NIGHT -- CONTINUOUS Dino's stands in the middle of his office, naked, his back to us, 8MM camera in hand, on the phone.  A NAKED WOMAN dances for Dino.  A Heavy Metal MUSIC VIDEO plays on a TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do this for you.  Fifteen thousand dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Machine's in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's in.  It will be his pleasure. INT.  PHONE BOOTH -- NIGHT -- CONTINUOUS DINO VELVET (V.O.) (from phone) Be at 366 Hoyt Avenue, three o'clock, tomorrow. Welles digs out his notepad, writing. WELLES (into phone) Where's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brooklyn.  Don't be late. EXT.  MOTEL COURTYARD, POOL -- NIGHT HORNS and TRAFFIC are HEARD.  Max and Welles sit in lawn chairs at the tiny pool.  Welles smokes.  Max drinks beer. They watch an ELDERLY WOMAN in a one piece bathing suit climb from the pool and walk to the diving board, diving in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to figure that out myself.  I have to see Machine without his mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still don't want to tell me what you're doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope. The old woman climbs out and heads back to the diving board. Welles takes out a thick ENVELOPE, hands it to Max.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is for you. Max doesn't understand, opens the envelope, finds about fifteen thousand dollars in the envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's money.  People use it to purchase goods and services. Max looks at it again, can't believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look... that's awful generous and everything...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not my money.  The woman I got it from is never going to give it a second thought.  Let's not make a big deal out of this, okay? (pause) Go be a race car driver.  Go run for President.  Whatever. Welles puts his cigarette out, stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll see you around. Welles walks away, heading to his room.  Max watches him go, doesn't know what to say, looks in the envelope. The old woman climbs out and heads back to the diving board. EXT.  BROOKLYN STREETS -- DAY A deserted, war zone neighborhood of abandoned, graffittied buildings.  A few burnt out cars on the street.  Welles drives through, watchful. Welles drives past a huge TWO-STORY WAREHOUSE, does a u-turn. He parks the car. INT.  WELLES' CAR -- DAY Welles checks his gun, returns it to his holster. EXT.  BROOKLYN WAREHOUSE -- DAY Welles climbs crumbling concrete stairs, looking all directions, crossing a LOADING DOCK towards a DOOR... INT.  BROOKLYN WAREHOUSE -- DAY Welles enters slowly, trying to get his eyes to adjust to the darkness.  A vast, empty space looms before him. In the middle of the warehouse, Dino Velvet stands, in a powder blue suit, holding an archery BOW and ARROW.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you are.  Come join us. There's a wrought IRON BED not far from Dino.  MACHINE is seated on the mattress, a huge man, wearing a leather S+M harness and the same WRESTLING MASK as in the snuff film. Welles gathers his courage, walks towards them. Dino pulls back on the bow, aiming away across the warehouse.  He stands by a TABLE with a QUIVER of ARROWS propped up.  He shoots an arrow toward a large TARGET... Strikes the target dead center, BULL'S-EYE.  As Welles gets closer, he notices several things ... ... a 16MM CAMERA mounted on a TRIPOD, facing the bed, along with several movie LIGHTS ... several BOWIE KNIFES are laid out on the table, beside a pair of HANDCUFFS... ... Machine is watching him as he approaches... Welles stops, not far from Dino and Machine, but keeping his distance.  Dino's still firing arrows at the target. Machine's still staring at Welles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. Machine just stares at him with bloodshot eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You brought the money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right here. Dino lets fly another arrow... another bull's-eye, then turns to look at Welles with a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are the women?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They should be here any minute. Welles comes forward slowly, places the envelope on the table, beside Bowie knifes.  He's sweating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are these for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm?  Oh, the knifes?  They're just props.  Nice, aren't they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Dino walks across towards the target.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Machine and I were just talking about knifes.  The beauty of knifes... Dino pulls arrows from the target.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was saying how fascinated he is by their simple ability to be sharp. The ability of a piece of metal to be so thin that it is almost nothing... Dino walks back to the table, replaces the arrows in the quiver, cueing another arrow in is bow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So close to nothingness that it cuts with minimum effort, because it's so non-intrusive.  Flesh is fooled.  It blooms open as the blade widens, but by then it's too late, because the knife's already doing its pure, simple damage. Dino shoots another arrow to the target. A CLATTER attracts Welles attention.  Far across the warehouse, a DELIVERY DOOR rolls upwards.  A CAR with tinted windows drives in... The MAN who opened the door, silhouetted in sunlight, stays behind to close the door as the car pulls forward...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, ours guests have arrived. Machine stands.  He is a giant. Welles takes a few steps back, wary, sweating hard now. The car parks across the warehouse, not far from the target. Dino puts another arrow in his bow, pulls it taunt, aims at the target... turns, aims the arrow at Welles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister Welles... would you be so kind as to remove any firearms from your person?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you... ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take out your gun! Welles brings his hand towards his holster...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly.  Let me see it. Welles takes out his gun, looks across the warehouse... The SILHOUETTED MAN is walking this way.  Can't tell who he is yet.  Machine heads the direction of the parked car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Empty the gun onto the table, very carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I don't know what this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, cunt!  Do exactly as I say, or I'll put this arrow through your throat. Welles obeys, helpless, dumps the bullets out on the table. The SILHOUETTED MAN'S getting closer.  It's Eddie Poole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put the gun down, take the handcuffs.  Handcuff yourself to the bed. Welles obeys, walks to the bed. Welles attaches one cuff to the bed's iron rail, fastens the other cuff around his wrist. Dino puts down the bow and arrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't know what to make of you at first, and you certainly had Eddie on pins and needles.  But, lo and behold, from out of the blue came an old business acquaintance to explain everything... Welles looks across to the car... The sinister lawyer, Longdale, gets out from behind the wheel and hands the keys to Machine, walks this way...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the fucker?  Motherfucker, doesn't look like anything... Eddie walks around the bed, studies Welles.  Welles watches him.  Eddie goes to stand behind Welles, rushes forward... PUNCHES Welles in the side of the head. Welles goes down, clutching his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't look like shit. Eddie pulls Welles to his feet, throws him against the bed, frisking him from head to toe. Longdale comes to stand beside Dino, nervous, taking out a tiny HANDGUN and pointing it at Welles.  Welles looks up, holding his head, afraid, sits on the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember Mr. Longdale, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get this over with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine idea. Dino comes to sit on the bed beside Welles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to go get the film you received from Mrs. Christian, bring it here and put it in my hand.  And to save time, so we make this as efficient as possible, there's an incentive... Dino puts his fingers in his mouth, lets out a sharp WHISTLE. Across the warehouse, Machine uses the car keys to open the trunk of the car, pulls SOMEONE out... It's Max, beaten bloody, bound, face swollen, gagged, hardly conscious.  Machine throws him to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... Welles tries to go towards Max, yanked back by the handcuffs, pulls the bed a few inches, but it's heavy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Friend of yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, he's got nothing to do with this... let him go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you guess what I'm going to say next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't know anything... he's got nothing to do with this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring the film, or we kill him. Sorrow and rage rises up in Welles, but there's no choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get it.  It's in a safe deposit box, in the city...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How cooperative.  Longdale will keep you company. Dino takes out HANDCUFF KEYS, throws them to Longdale. Longdale approaches Welles carefully, unlocking him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let Longdale's questionable choice of weapon give you any ideas. If his fey little gun puts enough little holes in you, you'll be just as dead... and so will Max.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move it, dirtbag... ! Eddie comes to SHOVE Welles.  Welles stumbles to the ground, gets to his feet.  Welles walks, takes one last glance back towards Max.  Longdale follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do hurry. EXT.  MANHATTAN STREETS -- DAY Welles' car moves in the slow flow of traffic into mid-town. INT.  WELLES' CAR -- CONTINUOUS Welles is at the wheel.  Longdale is in the passenger seat, gun held in his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were the middleman, am I right? Old man Christian wasn't about to go shopping for a snuff film himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't exactly have been possible for a man of his stature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, he sent you, gave you the money, his errand-boy.  And if you refused, it wasn't like you could tell anyone your pervert boss just asked you to get him a snuff film.  That's the beauty of lawyer/client privilege.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's trust.  Mr. Christian trusted me implicitly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must have paid you a lot, for you to risk everything.  Would've had to have cut yourself a real nice piece of money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was well compensated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why you got scared when Mrs. Christian hired me.  You knew about the film, figured it had to be in that safe.  How'd you find me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind how I found you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Followed me... must have freaked out when you saw me closing in on your buddies...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're no friends of mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Except, you're willing commit murder with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None of this would be happening if you would have left it alone.  If you weren't digging up a girl who died six years ago.  A girl no one even remembers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Anne Mathews, that was her name.  Her mom remembers her. Welles looks at Longdale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You found these smut dealers and asked to buy a snuff film, right? Wanted them to find you one.  Well, they didn't find you one, Longdale, they went out and made you one...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Anne Mathews was alive till you paid money to have her murdered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut your mouth and drive!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did it get him off, huh, watching them cut her up?  Tell me, because I really want to understand.  Did he jerk off to it?  You watch it with him, sit there giving him a handjob while you both watched... ? Longdale jams the gun against Welles' side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're making me very angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just tell me.  Tell me some more of the secrets you and Christian shared. What kind of degenerate pervert was he really?  What the fuck did he want with a snuff film?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're asking me why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm asking. Longdale sits back, wipes sweat from his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man like Mr. Christian, a great man... all his money, all his power... a man who attained everything there was to attain...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did he buy a film of some poor, lost girl getting butchered?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't it incredibly obvious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enlighten me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because he could.  He did it because he could. (pause) What other reason were you looking for? Welles tightens his grip on the wheel, numbed. EXT.  CHASE MANHATTAN BANK -- DAY Welles double parks, puts his hazard lights on. INT.  WELLES' CAR -- CONTINUOUS Longdale sits forward, looks to the bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got four minutes till I call Mr. Velvet and let him know there's a problem. Longdale takes a CELLULAR PHONE from his pocket, shows it. Welles climbs out, heading to the bank... INT.  BANK, SAFE DEPOSIT VAULT -- DAY Welles and the SAFE DEPOSIT MANAGER enter.  They go to put their KEYS in one drawer, unlocking it a pulling it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I show you to a booth...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I've got it. Welles pulls the drawer open, takes the 8MM film out and hands the empty drawer to the manager, exiting. INT.  BANK -- DAY Welles comes out from the SAFE DEPOSIT VAULT, pocketing the film, crossing towards the entrance, looking around... ... at other CUSTOMERS waiting on line... ... at a GUARD with a GUN at his side... Welles detours, toward one of the LOAN DESKS.  The BANK EMPLOYEE behind the desk is occupied, on the phone. As Welles moves past the desk, he grabs a PAIR of SCISSORS from a pencil holder and palms it, heading to the door... INT.  WELLES' CAR -- DAY Welles gets behind the wheel.  Longdale looks at his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You almost went over your limit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you. Welles puts the car in gear and drives. LONGDALE Give me the film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll get it when we get there. Longdale puts the gun to the side of Welles' head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me the film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead, shoot me.  Then try driving to Brooklyn with my brains all over the windshield. Welles keeps driving.  Longdale sits back, stewing. INT.  WAREHOUSE -- DAY The door is kicked open.  Welles enters, takes the 8MM FILM out and holds it in his hand.  Longdale follows. As Welles moves forward, his face goes slack... Machine is seated on the bed, Eddie and Dino stand smoking cigarettes, and further on, Max is tied to the target, slumped over, three arrows in his chest .  Dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!! Welles runs towards Max, crying out, tears in his eyes... Machine rises, goes to intercept Welles, grabbing him. Welles tries to break free, but Machine lifts Welles up and throws him brutally to the ground. Welles scrambles to get up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fuckers! Eddie comes to KICK Welles in the face. Welles is sent sprawling, blood gushing from his nose.  He lays there, stunned, weeping. Eddie pries the 8MM FILM from Welles' hand, tosses it... Dino catches the film. Machine comes to drag Welles towards the bed. Dino unspools the film, holding it up to examine it. Machine handcuffs Welles to the metal bedframe.  Welles falls to his knees, holding his face. Eddie PUNCHES Welles in the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a dead man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave him alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck off. Eddie PUNCHES Welles in the kidney.  Welles tries to protect himself.  Eddie raises his fist to punch again, but Machine catches Eddie's fist, throws Eddie back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck... !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promised him to Machine. Eddie looks up at Machine, who towers over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First things first.  You might want to watch this, Mr. Welles... Welles looks up through tears... Dino drops the 8MM FILM on the floor, takes a small bottle of lighter fluid from his pocket.  Longdale comes to watch. Welles watches helpless, agonizing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't... please... Dino drops the film to the floor, sprays it with fluid, takes out matches, light one, drops it... The 8MM FILM goes up in flame... Welles watches, quaking, hysterical, trying to pull himself towards the flame, dragging the bed... The film is destroyed by flame... Welles gives up, presses his face to the floor, eyes shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And so it ends.  It's as if she never existed. Welles falls back, gasping, wiping blood and tears and spittle from his face, getting slowly, to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't blame yourself.  You were in way over your head. He looks to Max's corpse, to the smoldering film... Swallowing back his fear, panic and rage...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Motherfuckers.  Small time, motherfuckers... !  Tell me something... Welles spits blood, hangs onto the bed for support.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know why you did it, Dino, Eddie... but, why'd the lawyer do it?  Must have been a helluva lot of money, right?  One fuckload of money... Welles sits on the bed, eyes burning with fury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, what are you all still doing small time, huh?  What are you still doing in the sewer, Eddie?! Christian gave Longdale a million dollars to find him a snuff film. How much did you ever see... ? Eddie and Dino look to Longdale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One million dollars, Dino.  How much did he tell you he had... Longdale's getting very nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's lying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at him.  You think he played it square?  How much did he give you, how much did he keep for himself? Eddie walks towards Longdale...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck's he talking about? Longdale takes out his gun, aims it at Machine, Dino and Eddie, scared...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay away from me. DINO VELVET What's going on, Longdale?  Did this happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sell us short, you fuck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay back!  You have a gun, Eddie, show it to me.  Now! Eddie slowly takes out his gun, seething.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put it on the ground, kick it here... Eddie puts the gun down, kicks it... Longdale picks it up, throws it far away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fucking lawyer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move back!  All of you... move! Machine, Dino and Eddie stand between Longdale and the car with tinted windows parked across the warehouse...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What were you thinking? Welles watches as Machine, Dino and Eddie back slowly away from Longdale.  Longdale's gun hand is shaky... Welles tries to drag himself towards the table where his gun and bullets are, dragging the bed, inch by inch... Longdale back away, trying to angle around the menacing trio so he can get to the car...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back off!  Everything's been taken care of, and I'm leaving now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not going anywhere if you fucked us, lawyer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm leaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got the guts, tough guy?  Gonna kill us all, is that it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You betrayed us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay where you are! Machine edges forward, holding his hands in the air. Longdale brandishes the gun...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep back! Machine, Eddie and Dino are held at bay...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not gonna live through this. Welles still tries to get to the table, wrist bleeding in the cuff, bed screeching across the floor... Machine, hands up, slowly reaches behind his shoulder, touches the handle of a huge KNIFE sheathed to his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our business is done, I'm leaving, no one's going to stop me... Longdale glances towards the car, seems like he's about to make a run for it.  Dino Velvet takes a step forward...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you! Machine unsheathes the KNIFE and THROWS... THUNK!  The knife imbeds to the hilt in Longdale's chest and Longdale's gun FIRES... Dino Velvet flies backwards, shot in the face! Dino hits the ground, screaming, writhing, hands to his face, blood pouring out between his fingers. Longdale falls back onto his ass, sitting there, eyes bugged out in surprise.  He looks down at the knife in his chest. Machine lets out a SCREAM, runs to Dino... Machine falls to his knees and grips Dino, tries to hold him.  Dino's screaming, squirming frantically... Longdale sits looking down at the knife in his chest, looks up, and gallons of blood pour from his mouth...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck. Eddie comes to look down at the Longdale.  Longdale falls back, dead, blood still flowing from his maw. Welles drags the heavy bed, getting closer to the table... Eddie spins, looks across to see Welles struggling... Dino breaks free from Machine, runs blindly, still holding his gushing face, falls, tries to get back up... Eddie runs towards Welles. Dino stumbles forwards, writhing, then suddenly lays still. Machine rises, looking at Dino.  Tears come out from Machine's eyes and roll down his mask. One last gasp and shudder from Dino's body; death rattle. Welles pulls the bed, practically pulling his arm from the socket, desperately clawing towards the table... The table is mere feet away... Eddie arrives, KICK Welles in the ribs... Welles recoils.  Eddies KICKS again.  Welles curls into a ball.  Eddie KICKS again...
direction.name: direction

He starts looking in his desk drawers, finds a MAGAZINE and opens it on the desk.  It's porn.  Eddie turns pages, looking at naked women.  He sits back in his chair, begins unbuckling his belt. Welles pulls back from the binoculars in disgust. WELLES

dialogue.raw_text: : INT.  ADJACENT OFFICE -- NIGHT THROUGH BINOCULARS: Eddie's on the phone, pouring himself a drink from the liquor bottle on his desk, finishing the call, hanging up.  He shakes his head in disgust, drinks the drink, walks out of view.  After a moment, the lights go out. EXT.  HOLLYWOOD HILLS -- NIGHT An old, dented CAR makes its way up the tight, twisting roads of the Hollywood Hills.  Eddie's at the wheel.  Not far behind, Welles' rental car follows... FURTHER ON Eddie's car pulls into the driveway under the porch of a ramshackle HOUSE, parks.  Welles' car passes by... FURTHER, AROUND A CURVE Welles' car slows once it's out of sight, turns around, moving back down the hill, slowly... INT.  WELLES' CAR -- CONTINUOUS Welles turns out his headlights, coming around the curve just far enough so the ramshackle house is in view.  Welles watches Eddie walk up the stairs to the house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT.  ADJACENT OFFICE -- DAY THROUGH BINOCULARS: Eddie has a visitor.  There's a pretty GIRL, wearing a tube top, in a chair facing his desk. Eddie's talking, gesticulating, smiling, cajoling. Welles watches through binoculars. THROUGH BINOCULARS: Eddie's still taking, stands, coming around the desk and placing a hand on the girl's shoulder. The girl says something.  Eddie responds.  The woman shakes her head, getting up to leave.  Eddie seems to be asking her to stay, following as she moves out of view.  Eddie comes back alone, sits at his desk, picks up the phone. INT.  ESPIONAGE SHOP -- DAY Ultra high tech for sale.  Welles examines items on the sales counter as the SALESPERSON watches: a pair of sma1l, round LISTENING DEVICES, a complicated RECEIVER/TAPE RECORDER, and a TONE DECODER with LED window.
